patterns: What is the full form of GNWL?
What is the difference between GNWL and WL?
responses: GNWL stands for 'General Waiting List'. It is the waiting list for passengers who are boarding the train from the station where the train originates or where the passenger has reserved accommodation. GNWL is given more preference than WL (Remote Location Waiting List) and RQWL (Request Waiting List).
GNWL is the most common waiting list type and is generally found on routes where the train originates from a station and there is a high demand for the seats/berths.
IRCTC is Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation. It is a subsidiary of the Indian Railways that handles the catering, tourism and online ticketing operations of the Indian Railways.
IRCTC stands for Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation. It is a subsidiary of Indian Railways and is responsible for online ticket booking, catering, and tourism services.

patterns: How can I cancel my ticket?

Can I cancel my ticket online?
responses: You can cancel your ticket online through the IRCTC website or mobile app. The cancellation process depends on the type of ticket you have booked and the time of cancellation. You can check the cancellation policy on the IRCTC website.

To cancel your ticket, you need to log in to your IRCTC account and go to the 'Booked Tickets' section. From there, you can select the ticket you want to cancel and follow the instructions on the screen.

If you want to cancel your ticket through the Indian Railways website, you need to go to the 'Cancel Ticket' page and enter your PNR number and other details. You can also cancel your ticket at the station or through the reservation counter.
You can cancel your ticket through the IRCTC app by selecting the 'Booked Tickets' option from the menu and following the instructions on the screen.

Tatkal booking is a facility provided by the Indian Railways for passengers who need to travel at short notice. Tatkal tickets can be booked one day before the date of journey. However, the Tatkal booking charges are higher than the regular booking charges.
To book a Tatkal ticket, you can visit the IRCTC website or mobile app. The Tatkal booking opens at 10:00 AM for AC classes and 11:00 AM for non-AC classes, one day before the date of journey.

The Tatkal booking is available for all classes except First AC. You can book a maximum of four passengers on a Tatkal ticket. The Tatkal booking charges range from Rs. 10 to Rs. 500 depending on the class of travel and distance of the journey.

responses: General quota is the most common quota used for booking train tickets. The general quota booking opens 120 days before the date of journey. The booking can be done through the IRCTC website, mobile app or at the railway station.

patterns: What is the full form of WL?
What is the meaning of WL?
What is the meaning of WL in Indian railway?
What is the meaning of WL in train ticket?
What is the meaning of WL in train ticket booking?
responses: WL stands for Waiting List. It is a status given to a ticket when all the confirmed tickets have been sold out. The waiting list tickets get confirmed only if some confirmed tickets are cancelled or the quota of the train is increased.

Waiting List (WL) is a status given to a train ticket when all the available seats on a train are sold out and the passenger is unable to get a confirmed seat. The passenger's name is added to a waitlist and a unique waiting list number is generated. If some confirmed ticket holders cancel their tickets, the seats are allotted to the passengers on the waiting list according to their waiting list number. The probability of getting a confirmed seat depends on the number of cancellations and the time of booking.

Waiting List, often abbreviated as WL, is a term used by the Indian Railways to indicate that a seat or berth on a particular train is currently unavailable, but may become available in the future. When all of the available seats and berths on a train have been sold, the Indian Railways will start assigning waitlisted status to additional ticket reservations.

responses: Waiting list (WL) is a system in Indian Railways that allows passengers to book tickets when all confirmed seats have been sold out. If a passenger has a waiting list ticket, they have not been assigned a seat on the train and can only board the train if a confirmed seat becomes available. WL tickets can be upgraded to RAC or confirmed tickets based on availability.
WL stands for Waiting List. It means that you have not been assigned a confirmed seat on the train and are currently on the waiting list.

patterns: How does the waiting list system work?
What is the probability of getting a waiting list ticket confirmed?

waiting list information in indian railway
Can I book a waiting list ticket online?
What happens if my waiting list ticket does not get confirmed?
responses: The waiting list system works based on cancellations and availability of seats. If a confirmed ticket is cancelled, the first person on the waiting list gets a confirmed ticket. The probability of getting a waiting list ticket confirmed depends on various factors like the type of ticket, the route, and the time of booking. There are different types of waiting lists like GNWL, RLWL, PQWL, etc. You can travel on a waiting list ticket only if it gets confirmed before the journey date. Yes, you can book a waiting list ticket online through the IRCTC website or app. If your waiting list ticket does not get confirmed, it automatically gets cancelled and the refund is processed as per the cancellation policy.

RAC stands for Reservation Against Cancellation. It is a type of ticket that provides a reserved seat on the train, but not a full berth. RAC passengers have to share the berth with another RAC passenger. RAC tickets are considered confirmed tickets, but they can be upgraded to a full berth if there are enough cancellations.

RAC stands for Reservation Against Cancellation. It is a type of ticket in which you are guaranteed a seat on the train, but only a partial berth. If any confirmed ticket gets canceled, the berth is allocated to the RAC ticket holders on a first-come-first-served basis.
RAC means Reservation Against Cancellation. It is a type of ticket in which you are guaranteed a seat on the train, but only a partial berth.

PQWL stands for Pooled Quota Waiting List. It is a waiting list status given to a ticket when the ticket is booked from a station that is not the originating station and there is no available seat in the general quota or the remote location quota. PQWL tickets get confirmed only if some confirmed tickets from the pooled quota are cancelled.

PQWL is a waiting list status in Indian Railways that is used when there is no seat available in the general quota or remote location quota. PQWL tickets have a lesser chance of getting confirmed than the tickets with GNWL or RLWL status.

PQWL is a type of waiting list in Indian Railways that is used for tickets booked from intermediate stations. PQWL tickets get confirmed only if some confirmed tickets are cancelled or the quota of the train is increased.

patterns: What is the process of chart preparation in Indian Railways?
What is the timing for chart preparation?
responses: Chart preparation is the process of finalizing the seat allocation of passengers on a train. During this process, the final reservation chart is prepared, which includes the details of all the passengers who have confirmed tickets. The timing for chart preparation varies depending on the train and the route. Generally, chart preparation is done a few hours before the departure of the train. Passengers can check the exact time of chart preparation on the IRCTC website.
TQWL stands for Tatkal Quota Waiting List. It is a waiting list status for tickets booked under the Tatkal quota, which is a scheme for passengers who need to travel at short notice.
TQWL is a type of waiting list in Indian Railways that is used for Tatkal tickets. Tatkal tickets are available for booking one day before the date of journey, and are subject to availability.

RLWL stands for Remote Location Waiting List. It is a waiting list status given to a ticket when the passenger is travelling to a station that is not the originating station, and there is no available seat in the general quota or the Tatkal quota.

RLWL is a type of waiting list in Indian Railways that is used for tickets booked from intermediate stations. RLWL tickets get confirmed only if some confirmed tickets are cancelled or the quota of the train is increased.
CNF stands for Confirmed. It is a status given to a ticket when a seat or berth has been confirmed for the passenger.
If your ticket has CNF status, it means that you have a confirmed seat or berth for your journey.

Sleeper class is a non-air-conditioned class of travel in Indian Railways. It has three tiers of berths arranged in bays of six, with no curtains for privacy. This class is suitable for those who want to travel long distances at an affordable price.

The booking for Premium Tatkal quota starts at 10 AM for AC classes and 11 AM for non-AC classes, one day before the date of journey.

patterns: What is the emergency number for Indian Railways?
Emergency number for trains in India
What is the phone number for railway emergency?
responses: The emergency number for Indian Railways is 138. This number can be used to report any emergency related to your train journey, such as accidents, medical emergencies, or security issues. You can also call this number to report any complaints or issues related to your journey.

If you are travelling on an Indian Railways train and need to report an emergency, you can call the railway emergency number at 138. This number is available 24/7 and can be used to report medical emergencies, security issues, or any other emergency related to your journey.
